description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Stabilized key app flows, including identities scoping by workspace and markdown editor behavior for touched files.
- Improved desktop and headless reliability, including OpenCode launcher defaults and OpenTUI compile path alignment.
Fixes & polish
- Fixed headless runtime crash path in compiled openwrk TUI.
- Added update polling UX improvements (12h checks + update-available indicator).
- Added optional "Give me a soul" quickstart path in the app.
Packaging / ops
- Bumped OpenWork monorepo version to 0.11.55 and aligned package metadata.
- Updated AUR package metadata and lockfile state for this release.
Compare:
